node.description: **Tomoko Fukunaga** is a Japanese animator and animation director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hinoueitaru) | [Website](https://hinoueitaru.com/)
Artist for various bishoujo games, mainly Key.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tensho_tw) | [Website](http://tenshohp.web.fc2.com/)

Representative director of [Bibury](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/). Often teams up with [Masayuki Nonaka](https://anilist.co/staff/116301/).

Former adult game scenario writer. He is a creator of cult classic Shizuku, Kizuato and To Heart.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takahasi)
Musical composer, widely known for his work in Air TV, Kanon, Clannad, Little Busters, and other Key pieces.

__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

__Introduction:__
Jun Maeda is a Japanese scriptwriter, lyricist, composer and music producer. He is known as one of the founding members of the software company Key, and he is the main composer and original creator for most of Key's visual novels. His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Maeda also worked on Summer Pockets, which he claimed "needed to make readers cry or it would mean the end for Key".

__Biography:__
Before forming Key, Maeda worked for the company Tactics where he had a hand in the creation of two games for that company: Moon and One: Kagayaku Kisetsu e.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tensho_tw) | [Website](http://tenshohp.web.fc2.com/)

Representative director of [Bibury](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/). Often teams up with [Masayuki Nonaka](https://anilist.co/staff/116301/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PROJECT_ROMEO)

Also known as Hajime Yamada (pseudonym). Romeo Tanaka is a male Japanese freelance artist and scenario writer for bishoujo games and adult games. He attended the University of Tsukuba. In 2007, Tanaka started to write his first light novel series entitled Jinrui wa Suitaishimashita which is published by Shogakukan. He is notable for having a hand in the creation of works such as Kana ~Imouto~, Cross†Channel and Saihate no IMA, and co-authored the scenario for Key's game Rewrite.

Key is a Japanese visual novel studio. It is known for making dramatic and plot-oriented visual novels. Some of their most famous works include CLANNAD, planetarian, and Little Busters!, among others. Several of their visual novels have received anime adaptations, making them quite well-known even outside of the visual novel community.

They've also formed Key Sounds Label for their music tracks, and they produced an Internet radio show called Key Net Radio which is now defunct as of 2010. Key works under the publishing company Visual Arts, where it originally sprung out of.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PROJECT_ROMEO)

Also known as Hajime Yamada (pseudonym). Romeo Tanaka is a male Japanese freelance artist and scenario writer for bishoujo games and adult games. He attended the University of Tsukuba. In 2007, Tanaka started to write his first light novel series entitled Jinrui wa Suitaishimashita which is published by Shogakukan. He is notable for having a hand in the creation of works such as Kana ~Imouto~, Cross†Channel and Saihate no IMA, and co-authored the scenario for Key's game Rewrite.

[Profile](http://nbcuni-music.com/maon/profile/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kurosakimaon) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/kurosakimaon) | [Youtube](http://www.youtube.com/user/maongue) 

Maon Kurosaki was a Japanese singer and songwriter signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan. After being discovered while working as a performer in Akihabara, Tokyo, she made her major debut in 2010, performing ending themes to the anime television series Highschool of the Dead. She released her debut album H.O.T.D. in September 2010, which features the ending themes from Highschool of the Dead. Her first two singles were used as ending themes to the anime television series A Certain Magical Index II.

Kurosaki's music is influenced by her love of anime and lolita fashion. Her songs have been featured in various anime series such as Jormungand, Tokyo Ravens, and The Fruit of Grisaia. She has collaborated with artists such as Mami Kawada, Kotoko, and Trustrick for her music releases. She performed twice at Anime Expo 2011 in Los Angeles, California, and is a regular performer at Japanese anime events such as LisAni, Animelo Summer Live, and Animax Musix. She has also appeared at Anime Festival Asia, Bangkok Comic Con, and CharaExpo. From 2011 to 2016, she was singer of the synthpop band [ALTIMA](https://anilist.co/staff/109511/), together with Motsu of the band Move.

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Official Website/Profile (SSP)](http://ssp-create.com/tadaaoi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tada_aoi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuAkxJn7ZlqVOLdiRQIeJVA) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/多田葵) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Tada)

Aoi Tada is a Japanese singer and former voice actress. She formerly belonged to Gekidan Himawari. Her most noted voice role is [Ed](https://anilist.co/character/16/) in [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/). She also performed an insert song to the series, "Wo Qui Non Coin."

In March 2005, she signed on to Moon-Bunny Entertainment and began her singer-songwriting career. She has performed theme songs for shows such as [Gunslinger Girl: Il Teatrino](https://anilist.co/anime/3231/), [Angel Beats!](https://anilist.co/anime/6547/) and [Charlotte](https://anilist.co/anime/20997/). She is also affiliated with the group Veil. She is credited for her Veil-related songs as Veil ∞ Aoi.

As of 2005, she has retired from voice acting but is still active as a singer.

(Source: Wikipedia)
